Ashu_eggs.name: Paneldactyl
Ashu_eggs.description:
ğŸ’ Egg: Paneldactyl
âš™ï¸ Version: 1.3
What is it: An easy and practical way to test other panels. With this Egg, you can install a Pterodactyl/Jexactyl panel on your own panel, literally a Panel inside another Panel (Panel only, Wings is for another Egg, if I can manage).
Bug fixes/changelogs:
 - (1.0) Release.
 - (1.0) Ability to run subcommands in the terminal (composer, setup, database, migrate, user, build, reinstall).
 - (1.0) System that checks "file integrity" (reinstalls if something is not installed).
 - (1.0) Possibility to build the panel (better for those who want to create their own themes/customizations).
 - (1.0) System that checks if the Egg is up to date.
 - (1.0) Everything is done via scripts, for better maintenance and updating.
 - (1.1) Added developer mode.
 - (1.1) Possibility to clone Dashboards directly from GitHub (Public/Private).
    ğŸ“ Variables: 
        - (1.0) Version.
        - (1.0) Panel `(Pterodactyl, Jexactyl, Jexactyl Brasil)`.
        - (1.0) Update warnings.
        - (1.1) Developer Mode
        - (1.1) GIT repository URL
        - (1.1) Choose the branch
        - (1.1) Git Username
        - (1.1) Git Access Token
        - (1.1) Change in the installation script.
        - (1.3) Change nodejs version management to NVM
    Docker: 
         - ARM64, ARM, 64x compatibility
âš ï¸ Attention:
   â—ï¸ A database is required.
Ashu_eggs.author: Matheusn.biolowons@gmail.com

Ashu_eggs.name: tModLoader
Ashu_eggs.description:
ğŸ’ Egg: tModLoader
âš™ï¸ Version: 4.1
â“ What it is: tModLoader is a modification of Terraria, enabling you to play with mods. Choose to play as you like!

ğŸ› Bugs fixed/changelogs:
â€¢ (3.0) [ARM64] Compatibility with the original repository, runs the same server as the 64x (no outdated third-party files, no emulation).
â€¢ (3.1) Critical errors fixed.
â€¢ (4.0) Egg optimization.
â€¢ (4.0) Docker updated.
â€¢ (4.0) Egg is no longer dependent on updates, everything is done by scripts, resulting in better maintenance.
â€¢ (4.0) Removed unnecessary settings.
â€¢ (4.0) Translation of variables.
â€¢ (4.1) Added Docker Dotnet 8

ğŸª„ What's different?
   â€¢ Unified Docker (same image, multiple architectures).
   â€¢ Modified Steamworks.NET.dll, more optimized and cross-platform.
   â€¢ Works on both ARM64 and 64x with the same performance.
   â€¢ No Emulation.
       ğŸ“ Variables that other Eggs do not contain: 
             â€¢ Seed.
             â€¢ Optimization.
             â€¢ Security.

ğŸ‘‘ Author: Ashu
ğŸ‘€ Check for updates: https://github.com/Ashu11-A/Ashu_eggs
Ashu_eggs.author: Matheusn.biolowons@gmail.com

Ashu_eggs.name: VPS
Ashu_eggs.description:
ğŸ’ Egg: VPS
âš™ï¸ Version: 2.1
â“ What is it: A VPS. This egg uses Proot (FakeRoot) which tricks the system into thinking you are a superuser. Installing a Pterodactyl inside another Pterodactyl has never been so real!

âš ï¸ Attention: 
     â€¢ Using Root in Docker is not recommended in any way. I am not responsible for any damage/action you may cause with this.
     â€¢ A minimum of 1GB of space is required.
     â€¢ Debian/Ubuntu distributions may take more than 15 minutes to complete the installation.
     â€¢ Ubuntu distributions are not working at the moment.

ğŸ Bugs fixed/changelogs:
     â€¢ (1.0) Release.
     â€¢ (2.0) Detects if the Egg is updated or not.
     â€¢ (2.0) Ability to change Linux Distribution: (Debian, Ubuntu, Alpine).
     â€¢ (2.0) Updated arguments, the system is now less restricted.
     â€¢ (2.0) Ability to change arguments.
     â€¢ (2.0) Fixed the Shutdown command, it is no longer necessary to kill the server.
     â€¢ (2.0) Fixed Initialization, now the Panel knows the Server is on.
     â€¢ (2.0) Installation script was rebuilt.
     â€¢ (2.1) Serious script bugs fixed.
     â€¢ (2.1) Ability to switch root between: PRoot(Default), PRoot-rs, FakechRoot + FakeRoot.
     â€¢ (2.1) Clean Installation Added.

ğŸ“ New Variables: 
     â€¢ (2.0) Use your own arguments?
     â€¢ (2.0) Your Arguments
     â€¢ (2.0) Linux Distribution
     â€¢ (2.1) Change Root
     â€¢ (2.1) Clean Installation?
